text: Mersin İdmanyurdu (also Mersin İdman Yurdu, Mersin İY, or MİY) Sports Club; located in Mersin, east Mediterranean coast of Turkey in 2000–01. Mersin İdmanyurdu has finished 2000–01 Second League season for the 27th time. This was the last season of Second League as second division in Turkish football league system. Team finished second stage at seventh place in 2000–01 season and placed to newly founded 2001-02 Second League Category B in the next season. Macit Özcan was club president. Levent Arıkdoğan managed the team at the start of the season. Tarkan Özyılmaz had the most appearances, 30, while he shared the top goalscorer title with Zeynel Abidin Oktay with 13 goals. ==2000–01 Second League participation== Mersin İdmanyurdu took place in Group 1 in 2000–01 Second League season. League was played in three stages. In the first stage 50 teams in five groups (10 clubs in 4 groups and 11 teams in 2nd group) played for first two rankings to play in promotion group. The promotion group consisted of those 10 teams. At the end of the second stage top two teams promoted to 2001-02 First League. Remaining teams in each ranking group played in classification groups, by carrying points and goals from ranking groups. Bottom two teams relegated to 2001-02 Third League at the end of the season. In the third stage, 8 clubs (3 from the promotion group and 1 each from 5 classification groups) played one-leg play-off games in Antalya Atatürk Stadium to determine the third team to be promoted to First League.Details for standings and results (not round-by-round) can be found in Cem Pekin Archives. Retrieved on 30 March 2010. Mersin İdmanyurdu took place in Group 1 consisted of 10 teams and finished first stage at 7th place and couldn't took place in promotion group. In classification group, team finished 7th again and could not attend to promotion play-off games. In the next season a new league system was introduced. In the new system a one group second level division is created and named as "Second League Category A" (which would have been named as "League B" starting from 2005–06 season and renamed as "TFF First League" starting from 2010–11 season. The Second League continued as third tier and renamed as "Second League Category B", "League B", and "TFF Second League" accordingly. Promotion Group team who remained after promotions, relegated teams from top division and, top two teams from Classification Groups formed newly founded "Category A". Mersin İdmanyurdu who finished 7th in Classification Group 1 and placed in Category B in the next season, which may mean an automatic relegation. ===Results summary=== Mersin İdmanyurdu (MİY) 2000–01 Second League season league summary: {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: right;" |- !rawspan=2| !rawspan=2| !colspan=9|Overall !rawspan=1| !colspan=8|Home !rawspan=1| !colspan=8|Away |- ! Source: 2000–01 Turkish Second Football League pages from TFF website, Turkish-Soccer website, and Maçkolik website. ===Ranking group games=== Mersin İdmanyurdu (MİY) 2000–01 Second League season first half game reports in Ranking Group 1 is shown in the following table. Kick off times are in EET and EEST. Sources: 2000–01 Turkish Second Football League pages. ===Classification group league table=== Classification Group 1 was played with 8 teams remaining after top two of ranking group were promoted to promotion group. Top team in the group promoted to promotion play-offs, while bottom one team relegated to 2001–02 TFF Third League season. Points and goals were carried from ranking group. MİY obtained 2 wins, 6 draws and 6 losses and finished 7th . Normally, only the last team, Bakırköyspor would have relegated. However, starting from 2001–02, a new system was introduced to second level football league in Turkey. In the new system Second League is divided into two categories: Category A and Category B. Those teams who took place in 2000–01 Second League Promotion Group and top two teams from each classification groups formed Category A. Rest of the teams in Classification Group 1, 3rd through 7, included in Category B. Therefore, MİY relegated to third level league, 2001–02 TFF Second League - Category B after the end of the season. Mersin İY's league performance in 2000–01 Second League Classification Group 1 in season is shown in the following table.See Cem Pekin Archives for full league tables, and promotions and relegations at 2000-01 Türkiye 2. Ligi. Although classification group games should have been accumulated on ranking group data in the league tables, in TFF pages classification group tables are shown as unaccumulated. See Classification Group 1 page at TFF website. Maçkolik site makes the same mistake: See maçkolik 2001–02 Second League Classification Group 1 page. Final standings are seen correctly in former source. On the other hand, this source does not supply round-by-round league table. Therefore place after rounds columns are empty. Searched on 10 June 2015. ===Classification group games=== Mersin İdmanyurdu (MİY) 2000–01 Second League season first half game reports in Classification Group 1 is shown in the following table. Kick off times are in EET and EEST. Sources: 2000–01 Turkish Second Football League pages. ==2000–01 Turkish Cup participation== MİY did not participate in 2000–01 Turkish Cup due to eligibility rules. 39th Turkish Cup (played as "Türkiye Kupası") was played by 64 teams. Top four teams in previous year's classification groups were qualified for the Cup from Round 1. Mersin İdmanyurdu had finished 1999–2000 in 5th place and did not qualify. Cup was played in 4 rounds prior to quarterfinals. All rounds were played in one- leg elimination system. Gençlerbirliği won the cup for the 2nd time.2000–01 Turkish Cup (Türkiye Kupası) pages. Official page from TFF (Turkish Football Federation) website, retrieved on 10 June 2015 . An alternative source is maçkolik cup page. Cem Pekin Archives at Turkish Soccer site provides information in . ==Management== ===Club management=== Macit Özcan, mayor of Mersin city was president. Özcan was elected President in club congress after 18 April 1999 local elections. Mayors presided the club many times in its history. ===Coaching team=== Levent Arıkdoğan was head coach at the start of the season. 2000–01 Mersin İdmanyurdu head coaches: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: left;" |- ! ! In the team since 12 August 1998. He was an amateur player and was professionalized for the first time in the mid-season on 29 January 2001. He had signed for two seasons and continued in the next season. He was an amateur player who has found chance to appear in previous seasons too. He was later professionalized for the first time by MİY in Summer 2001. In the team since 29 September 1999. Contract extension on 20 July 2000. At the end of the season player's contract ended and was extended, but later mutually terminated on 26 September 2001 and he signed to Mustafakemalpaşaspor for the rest of the next season. Player signed on 27 October 2000. Player's contract with his previous team İstanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor had been mutually terminated. At the end of the season player's contract ended but was extended for the next season.
